arts.ttl: Wrexham on brink of third consecutive promotion, how far can Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney take the team?
arts.sum: It’s been stated by many experts that, the Reynolds and McElhenney may need additional external funding given the highly financial competitive nature of the Championship with so many clubs looking to secure a place in the promised land that is the English Premier League. Matters on the pitch also helped and despite falling at the final hurdle in their first season in charge, under the guidance of coach Phil Parkinson and boosted with a sizeable playing budget, Wrexham secured two back-to-back promotions which saw them move to their current situation in England’s League one (third tier).

arts.ttl: Wrexham beat Exeter to maintain promotion hopes
Exeter City full of confidence they can dent Wrexham's Hollywood story
arts.sum: “Is it a game that is going to be difficult, against a team up the league that expects to win? IF anyone thinks that Exeter City are treating Saturday’s League One clash with high-flying Wrexham as a free hit, then think again.

arts.ttl: Exeter City boss Gary Caldwell blames his Scottish accent for red card
arts.sum: “I’ve seen it from so many different angles and I still think it’s a good goal,” Caldwell said. Caldwell also served a one-match ban earlier in the season, for an accumulation of yellow cards, while coach David Perkins was handed a £500 fine after being sent off against Lincoln in the clash at St James Park in November.

arts.ttl: The huge amount of money Ryan Reynolds has spent and lost on Wrexham
arts.sum: The Hollywood co-owners have spent a massive amount of money on helping Wrexham's rise through the leagues

arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds told Wrexham star tipped for Premier League could fetch record-breaking fee
arts.sum: Wrexham defender Max Cleworth has been tipped to play in the Premier League and could see Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney's club break their record transfer exit if he does leave

arts.ttl: Inside the world of ego-driven super-stadiums: As Tottenham lead 'Disneyfication' of fans, Man United are desperate to cash in... and Chelsea risk being left in the wake of Wrexham!
arts.sum: IAN HERBERT: Chelsea thought they were on a straight road towards rebuilding Stamford Bridge when they cleared a fiendishly sensitive obstacle, last year.

arts.ttl: Preview: Exeter City vs. Wrexham - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Exeter City and Wrexham, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Exeter City's model a success and can continue to grow the club
arts.sum: “I think it’s a brilliant model for smaller clubs like ourselves, who have kind of run into financial difficulty because of overextending when the money quite simply isn’t there and putting a club of ours into jeopardy,” City manager Gary Caldwell said. As supporters of the Grecians’ League One rivals Reading sweat over the very existence of their club – they could be expelled from the EFL if controversial Dai Yongge does not sell the club before April 5 – the Exeter City Trust model is again being held as a shining beacon of how a lower league club can be run efficiently and without incurring huge debt.

arts.ttl: Exeter City youngster Liam Oakes signs pro contract
arts.sum: Currently, Liam is out on loan at Plymouth Parkway alongside fellow academy graduate Tom Dean, getting his first experience of regular men's football. Exeter City youngster Liam Oakes has signed his first professional contract with the club.
